model module¶

class model.Pace(VDOT, intensity)¶

Bases: object

Store paces Easy, Marathon, and Temo as range of percentages

methods allow the range for each intensity to be returned as objects of pace class in velocity or minutes/mile

PACE_DICT = {'tempo': (0.83, 0.86, 0.89), 'marathon': (0.75, 0.79, 0.84), 'easy': (0.55, 0.65, 0.74)}¶
convert_timedelta()¶

Return list of pace times (low, avg, high) converted from timedelta object

pace_range()¶

Return the range of times in minutes/mile for a given intensity

velocity()¶

Return list of velocity (low, avg, high) in meters/minute for a given intensity

class model.Segment(intensity, user, workout=None, rep=1, time=None, distance_in_miles=None, distance_as_percent=None, rest=None)¶

Bases: object

Pace() and distance or time components of a workout

calc_distance()¶

Return distance covered in a segment.

show_segment()¶

Return tuple containing string representation of the segment, for user display

class model.TrainingPlan(user)¶

Bases: object

Return list of 18 Week objects for a user

each Week object contains a tuple of Workout objects each Workout object contains a tuple of Segment objects

make_list_of_days()¶

Makes list of the calendar datetime objects for the training_plan

to return the day use datetime class attr: .day to return the YYYY_MM_DD (ISO 8601) format use instance method: .isoformat() see python docs for additional datetime methods

weekly_mileage¶
class model.Week(user, percent_peak_mileage, plan, workouts, days=6)¶

Bases: object

Returns x days of training as a list

Uses user race.VDOT to determine distance of workouts, and remainder of peak mileage to assign distances to non-quality days.

create_remaining_days(workouts)¶

Return dynamicaly-generated remaining training days

show_week()¶

String representation of week distance. For user display

class model.Workout(*segments)¶

Bases: object

Returns tuple of segments

a single workout is a tuple of segments ‘quality days’, specific instructions for workouts with distance, time, pace attributes

final_segments(segments)¶

Return the less of two segments when tuple passed for segment

show_workout()¶

String representation of workout distance. For user display

model.connect_to_db(app)¶

Connect to the database.
